CatDescriptText: Edward Brennan, public relations specialist, Whitehall and Emma Jean Smith, gas company employee, Schenley Heights, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think there will be a Third World War?  If so, what do you think will be the cause or causes?" Edward Brennan's answer reads: "I don't think there will be World War III.  There might be a lot of little wars, but I think the nuclear bomb is a deterrent to World War III."  Emma Jean Smith's answer reads: "I believe so, and for a number of reasons.  It could result from unrest over Africa or some other place."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Edward Brennan wearing fedora, eyeglasses, diagonally striped necktie, dark jacket, and light colored coat, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, LIberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Emma Jean Smith wearing earrings, two strand necklace, and fur coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
